title: No-Bake Mango Yogurt Chocolate Bites
description: Refreshing 3-ingredient no bake mango yogurt chocolate bites! Creamy Greek yogurt and fresh mango covered in rich dark chocolate - naturally sweetened, higher in protein and ready in just 10 minutes prep.

thumbnail.alt: No-Bake Mango Yogurt Chocolate Bites recipe card - showing the creamy mango yogurt filling inside dark chocolate shell

instructions.text: Melt the dark chocolate using a double boiler or microwave in 30-second intervals. Pour melted chocolate into your silicone molds, covering the bottom and the sides. Flash freeze for 10 minutes or until set.

image.alt: Step 1: Silicone molds lined with melted dark chocolate, showing the chocolate shell base ready for freezing

instructions.text: Dice the mango into approx. inch thick pieces. In a medium bowl, combine the Greek yogurt and diced mango. Gently fold together until evenly mixed.

image.alt: Step 2: Fresh mango diced into chunks and mixed with creamy Greek yogurt in a medium bowl

instructions.text: Remove the molds from the freezer. Add 2-3 teaspoons of the mango yogurt mixture to each mold on top of the set chocolate base.

image.alt: Step 3: Adding spoonfuls of mango yogurt mixture into chocolate-lined silicone molds

instructions.text: Drizzle or spread the remaining melted chocolate over the yogurt layer to create the top.
Freeze for 2 hours or until completely set. Remove from molds and sprinkle with sea salt.

notes: For vegan version, substitute Greek yogurt with coconut yogurt - it pairs beautifully with mango!
Store in refrigerator for up to 3 days or freezer for up to 1 week
Silicone molds work best for easy removal. Ice cube trays work too!
Can use frozen mango - thaw completely and drain excess liquid first
Let sit 1-2 minutes at room temperature before serving for easier eating
equipment: Silicone molds or ice cube trays

story.subtitle: why you'll love them
paragraphs: If you're looking for the perfect no-bake mango dessert that actually satisfies your sweet tooth, you have to try these no bake mango yogurt chocolate bites. The natural sweetness of mango paired with creamy Greek yogurt (sneaky protein + probiotics) and topped with dark chocolate is such a good combo. The richness of the 70% dark chocolate balances out the sweetness of the mango perfectly, making these one of my favourite easy, healthy no-bake desserts.

I love these all year round, but they're especially refreshing to make in the summer when you don't want to turn the oven on. Highly recommend meal prepping a batch and keeping them in the freezer for when your sweet tooth hits (just let them thaw for about 10 minutes before!). The best part? These mango yogurt bites are made with just 3 simple ingredients that you probably already have on hand.

faq.question: Can I make these mango yogurt bites vegan?
faq.answer: Yes! Simply substitute the Greek yogurt with your favorite plant-based yogurt. Coconut yogurt works particularly well and complements the mango flavour beautifully.

faq.question: How long do these mango chocolate bites last?
faq.answer: Store in the refrigerator for up to 3 days or in the freezer for up to 1 week. For best texture eat cold.

faq.question: What type of mold should I use?
faq.answer: Silicone molds work best as they're easy to remove the bites from. You can also use silicone ice cube trays!

faq.question: What chocolate should I use?
faq.answer: I used a high-quality dark chocolate with 70% cocoa content. Refined sugar free chocolate works great too.

faq.question: Can these be made ahead for meal prep?
faq.answer: Absolutely! These are perfect for meal prep. Make a batch and keep them in the freezer for up to a week. They make great grab-and-go summer treats.

tips: Let the bites sit at room temperature for 1-2 minutes before serving for easier eating
Use the ripest mango for the best natural sweetness
If your chocolate is too thick, add a tiny bit of coconut oil to thin it out

alternatives: Regular yogurt (though texture will be less thick)
